data.title: Gary Larson Biography
data.meta_description: A behind-the-scene look at the life of Gary Larson.
data.text:
Gary Larson retired from creating "The Far Side" comic strip in 1995.

Gary Larson is best known for creating the popular comic strip "The Far Side," which ran from 1980 to 1995.

Gary Larson decided to end "The Far Side" because he felt he had accomplished everything he wanted to with the strip and wanted to pursue other interests.

There have been no official announcements regarding Gary Larson returning to create new comics.

Gary Larson drew inspiration for "The Far Side" from his love of nature, animals, and the absurdity of everyday life.

Gary Larson, the creator of "The Far Side" comic strip, is known for his quirky sense of humor and unique perspective on the world.

Larson is a self-taught cartoonist who never took formal art classes, yet he was able to create a wildly successful and beloved comic strip.

In addition to his work as a cartoonist, Larson is also an accomplished musician and has played in several bands over the years.

Larson is a lifelong nature enthusiast, and many of his comics feature animals and wildlife in humorous situations.
